data.instructionText: Match the enabler to its description.

items.text: Leveraging others as thinking partners, experts, or additional voices to speak up and act.
Seeking more data, knowledge, evidence, or options to address the issue at hand.
Seeking answers and clarity using inquiry (vs. making arguments / drawing conclusions).
Reflecting on the issue from a new perspective (e.g., highlighting risks, debating assumptions, finding win-wins).
Recognizing that your actions may set the standard for others and acting based on that assumption.
Understanding the needs, fears, and motivators of the person (or people) you want to persuade.

incorrect.content:
That’s incorrect.
When it comes to addressing an ethical issue, there is no perfect or ‘correct’ enabler to use. The enablers on this screen are all useful and appropriate – the key is determining which ones feel most comfortable to you and will allow you to speak up in the situations that arise.
